inclusion.criterion: Patient has severe calcific native mitral valve stenosis with mitral annular calcification with echocardiographically derived mitral valve area (MVA) of ≤1.5 cm2, or severe mitral regurgitation with severe mitral annular calcification and at least moderate mitral valve stenosis.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patient is symptomatic from mitral valve disease, as demonstrated by reported NYHA Functional Class II or greater, or symptoms during stress test.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The patient is at least 22 years old.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The heart team agrees (and verified in the case review process) that valve implantation will likely benefit the patient.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: All patients must be approved by the Patient Selection and Procedure Management Steering Committee (at least 2 member votes, one must be a cardiac surgeon).
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The study patient has been informed of the nature of the study, agrees to its provisions and has provided written informed consent as approved by the Institutional Review Board (IRB) of the respective clinical site.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: The study patient agrees to comply with all required post-procedure follow-up visits including annual visits through 5 years and analysis close date visits, which will be conducted as a phone follow-up.
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Heart Team assessment of operability (the heart team considers the patient is a surgical candidate).
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Evidence of an acute myocardial infarction ≤ 1 month (30 days) before the intended treatment [defined as: Q wave MI, or non-Q wave MI with total CK elevation of CK-MB ≥ twice normal in the presence of MB elevation and/or troponin level elevation (WHO definition)].
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Mitral annulus is not calcified (only applies to patients included in Native MV arm).
exclusion.label: met
